1.text: Punch a hole 1⁄2 in (1.3 cm) in from the short side of a credit card.

2.text: Make 2 more holes on the opposite short side of the credit card.

3.text: Cut straight lines from the short edges of the card to the centers of each hole.

4.text: Use your scissors to cut curved notches into the long sides of the credit card.

5.text: Feed the earbuds through the 2 holes on one of the short edges.

6.text: Wind the cord around the notches before putting the jack in the empty hole.

7.text: Paint or draw on 2 clothespins if you want your holder to have a design.

8.text: Stack and hot-glue the clothespins so the openings face opposite directions.

9.text: Clamp the earbuds in the top clothespin.

10.text: Wrap the cord around the clothespins lengthwise to secure it.

11.text: Make a 4 in × 4 in (10 cm × 10 cm) H-shaped template with paper.

12.text: Trace and cut the shape from a piece of stiffened felt.

13.text: Place a self-adhesive Velcro dot in the center of each long edge.

14.text: Wrap the earbud cord around the notches in the felt.

15.text: Fold the felt in half vertically to secure the Velcro dots together.

16.text: Peel the labels off of a circular plastic mint container.

17.text: Drill 2 holes on the side of the container underneath the lid opening.

18.text: Feed a key ring through the drilled holes.

19.text: Attach fabric to the top of the container with Mod Podge to customize it.

20.text: Wrap your earbuds by hand into a circular coil.

21.text: Place the earbuds in the mint container and close the lid.
